(I guessed the component to assign - no idea really - sorry.)
Matthew Cooper.

Changed version to 0.7.1 as I just installed the all-in-one bundle and it
happens with that too.
Changed to 1.0 as it happens with 1.0M8 as well.

I believe this is working as designed although I'll admit the design is not pretty.  The WS-I validator needs to obtain some files (called Test Assertion Docments) from the internet that provide validation rules.  For legal reasons these files can't be redistributed so the WS-I validator has to go off an fetch 'em.  To workaround this problem you can turn off the WS-I validator (Window->Preferences->Web Services->Profile Compliance then set both of the cryptic WS-I XXX compliance level fields to ignore).  This should prevent the validator from going off to the internet.

I'll leave this bug open to track the issue that (IMHO)the WS-I validator should not need to go off to the internet to obtain the TADs.
I think this belongs in the wsi component.
It's unlikely we'll get a chance to address this.
